p: Likewise, total contents of KBAs and AKBAs as well as the individual isomer proportion in B. occulta were indistinguishable from those of B. sacra ( Figure 6a, b, c). Moreover, the contents of further boswellic and lupeolic acids in oleogum resins of B. occulta and B. sacra are very similar [ 5]. However, analysis of the essential oils of B. occulta revealed an outstandingly high amount of methyl esters, especially 1-methoxydecane, which was identified so far as a major constituent only for this species [ 52, 53].
